Package com.project.neo.Baby

Class BabyService

java.lang.Object
com.project.neo.Baby.BabyService
@Service public class BabyService extends Object
This class forms the business layer of the application. It serves as the middle layer between the API layer (Babycontroller) and the data layer (Babyrepository). This is where all core operations are executed.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    BabyService(Babyrepository babyrepository, S3Service amazonfile)
    This method conducts a dependency injection for the babyrepository interface to connect with the mongoDB database, and the amazonfile object that connects it to the S3 bucket containing sweat data.

    • add_NoteTimeStamp

      public void add_NoteTimeStamp(String time_instant, String note, Integer id)
      Adds a note at a specific timestamp to a specific baby in the database by creating a new key-value pair in the note timestamp hashmap.
      Parameters:
      time_instant - Time at which note occurred.
      note - String containing description to be added.
      id - Specific baby to add note to.

    • add_PrickTimeStamp

      public void add_PrickTimeStamp(String time_instant, double prick_data, int id)
      Adds prick data at a specific timestamp to a specific baby in the database by creating a new key-value pair in the prickdata timestamp hashmap.
      Parameters:
      time_instant - Time at which prick reading occurred.
      prick_data - Prick data.
      id - Specific baby to add prick data to.

    • add_SweatTimeStamp

      public void add_SweatTimeStamp(int id)
      This method scans through timeStamps and currentValues lists which store the data imported form the csv file, applies the delay and calibrations specified by the user (if any) to convert sweat data from current (nA) to blood glucose concentrations (mmol/l) and then updates these values for the baby stored in the database. Only data after the previous GET request was made is proccessed. By default, a delay for 20 minutes is set with a calibration intercept of 0.2mmol/l and gradient of 1.1mmol/l/time, which will run unless the user has inputted custom values for that day. Calculation is as such: Blood-Glucose concenteration = (Current value - Intercept)/Gradient.
      Parameters:
      id - identifies baby object stored in database to perform operations on.

    • returnSingleBaby

      public Optional<Baby> returnSingleBaby(int id)
      This method is called by the API layer whenever the user wants to view glucose levels. Once called, it calls the updatesweatlevels method which reads data from the specific babies csv data file (which will be named as its id.csv). This then calls the add_SweatTimestamp method which calibrates and stores the data in the database.
      Parameters:
      id - Specific baby to be analysed.
      Returns:
      Returns the updated baby object stored in the database once all operations have been conducted to the API layer.

    • UpdateSweatLevels

      public void UpdateSweatLevels(int i)
      This method reads in the csv file and stores it in the lists timeStamps and currentValues. Once values have been stored, it calls the add_timestamps method which analyses and saves the data to the specific baby object.
      Parameters:
      i - stores the value of the baby id that is being analysed.

    • addCalibration

      public void addCalibration(double gradient, double intercept, int id)
      Adds calibration for the current day for both gradient and intercept by adding a new key-value pair in the specific baby's sweat time stamp hashmap.
      Parameters:
      gradient - Gradient of calibration graph.
      intercept - Intercept of calibration graph.
      id - Id of specific baby.

    • addDelay

      public void addDelay(Long delay, int id)
      Adds delay for the current day by adding a new key-value pair in the specific baby's delay time stamp hashmap.
      Parameters:
      delay - Gradient of calibration graph.
      id - Id of specific baby.
